details.formulaStrippedArticleTitle: Exploiting multiple a priori spectral models for adaptive radar detection
details.title: Exploiting multiple a priori spectral models for adaptive radar detection

kwd: generalised likelihood ratio test-based detection algorithms

details.standardTitle: Exploiting multiple a priori spectral models for adaptive radar detection
details.abstract: This study deals with the problem of adaptive radar detection when a limited number of training data, due to environmental heterogeneity, is present. Suppose that some a priori spectral models for the interference in the cell under test and a lower bound on the power spectral density (PSD) of the white disturbance term are available. Hence, generalised likelihood ratio test-based detection algorithms have been devised. At the design stage, the basic idea is to model the actual interference inverse covariance as a combination of the available a priori models and to account for the available lower bound on the PSD. At the analysis stage, the capabilities of the new techniques have been shown to detect targets when few training data are available as well as their superiority with respect to conventional adaptive techniques based on the sample covariance matrix.

ieee.displayText: Antonio De Maio, Danilo Orlando, Chengpeng Hao, Goffredo Foglia, "Adaptive Detection of Point-Like Targets in Spectrally Symmetric Interference", Signal Processing IEEE Transactions on, vol. 64, pp. 3207-3220, 2016, ISSN 1053-587X.
ieee.title: Adaptive Detection of Point-Like Targets in Spectrally Symmetric Interference

ieee.displayText: Chengpeng Hao, Danilo Orlando, Goffredo Foglia, Gaetano Giunta, "Knowledge-Based Adaptive Detection: Joint Exploitation of Clutter and System Symmetry Properties", Signal Processing Letters IEEE, vol. 23, pp. 1489-1493, 2016, ISSN 1070-9908.
ieee.title: Knowledge-Based Adaptive Detection: Joint Exploitation of Clutter and System Symmetry Properties

ieee.title: Adaptive detection based on multiple a-priori spectral models for MIMO radar in compound-Gaussian clutter

ieee.title: Invariance Theory for Adaptive Detection in Interference With Group Symmetric Covariance Matrix
